result.execSummary:
The defendant Suzanne B Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intention. Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(4).
  • Intention. Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(4).
  • Intention. Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(4).
  • Intention. Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(4).
  • Intention. Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Porter, Suzanne B
defendant.address: W5449 Grand Marsh Rd, Dalton, WI 53926

records.addlTxt: from Agent Michael Pulice dated August 28, 2018 re: court obligations are paid in full
Probation review hearing on September 17, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1-5 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant concurs.  ADA concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1-5.  Court orders counts 6-10 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNTS 1- 5 (EACH)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-court costs
-Restitution - $1,390.10
-Defendant is not to have any more than 3 dogs at the residence and is to cooperate with the vet in establishing and maintaining healthy conditions for the animinals at the residence.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.


Court adjourned at 10:03 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 20, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:55 a.m.
